cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles east of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn west-southwest toward the northwestern Bahamas Tuesday–Wednesday and westward toward the east coast of Florida Wednesday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east coast of Florida between the Volusia/Brevard County line and Hallandale Beach (near southeast-central Florida)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Volusia/Brevard County Line to Hallandale Beach including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas and the southeastern U.S. coast from Hallandale Beach FL northward to coastal Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely late Wednesday with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if Nicole reaches hurricane strength near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the coast from Hallandale Beach northward, including Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized totals up to 6 inches possible, producing flooding in low-lying areas and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breaking waves and coastal erosion could impact berthing areas; hazardous seas will disrupt pilot and cargo operations.
